[Posted originally to the junit-devel mailing list, with a few different
bi=
ts of content]

Is anything planned in JUnit4 to mirror the Category attrib=
ute in NUnit?
For those who haven't used NUnit, this is an attribute which =
allows you
to classify a test fixture (test class) or indeed an individual =
test.
You can then tell NUnit to exclude certain categories or include cert=
ain
categories.

In my job, we're currently experimenting with the best way=
 of developers
running tests across many different projects and platforms, =
and ways of
including system tests written using unit test tools. I *think*=

categories would really help here, although I'm more than willing to be
to=
ld why there are better alternatives. They would allow tests to be
grouped =
in code according to what was being tested, but also allow for
certain test=
s to be marked as "very long running" (the kind of test
which might be done=
 on a weekly basis rather than nightly) or
"performance" (functionality whi=
ch is tested for correctness elsewhere,
but set up in this test to get perf=
ormance measurements) etc.

I've seen a feature request for this on the SF =
site, but it talks of the
test runner doing the work - which would certainl=
y allow whole classes
to be classified accordingly (although each runner wo=
uld probably need
to implement the functionality), but the individual tests=
 might be
somewhat harder to include/exclude, if the normal introspector is=
 being
used.

Personally, I think this would be great functionality to have=
 in the
core of JUnit4.

So, why am I wrong? :)
 
Jon Skeet
